Issues.Title: WPF Textbox work abnormally when IME is Chinese Simplified(Microsoft Pinyin)
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: .Net 5.0
* Windows version: Version 2004(OS build 19041.1415)
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? No.
 
Issue description:
1.New a wpf textbox with data binding, data bidding is like:
TextBox Text="{Binding Path=InputText,UpdateSourceTrigger=PropertyChanged}"

2.Choose 'Chinese(Simplified China) Microsoft Pinyin' as IME .
3.Enable 'Use previous version of Microsoft Pinyin', please refer attached video 'use_previous_version.mov' for detailed steps.
4.Input serval chars like 'qwert', then Chinese IME popup, click '2' to select '请问让'.  '请问让' is corresponding to 'qwer', and then choose '2' for left char 't', then the issue happens. Could refer attached video 'textbox_lost_chinese_chars.mov' for details

Excepted result:
'请问让她' should be present in textbox.

Actual result:
only '她' is in textbox. the previous chinese chars '请问让' are missing.

 Investigation:
1. If disable 'Use previous version of Microsoft Pinyin', the issue won't happen. 
2. Remove 'UpdateSourceTrigger=PropertyChanged' in TextBox binding, the issue won't happen. 
Attach my test project 'wpfapp8.zip' 

Attached files:
1. 'use_previous_version.mov' for enabling 'Use previous version of Microsoft Pinyin'
2. 'textbox_lost_chinese_chars.mov' for issue
3. 'wpfapp8.zip' is simple textbox test code4. 
[WpfApp8.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/8169258/WpfApp8.zip)
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/89184738/156355305-b6cdf349-96ce-4a25-9542-fc538e5c2da6.mov
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/89184738/156355411-f648df27-4bd9-4c32-b670-aa9ced73d9bd.mov
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WPF Textbox work abnormally when IME is Chinese Simplified(Microsoft Pinyin)" (#6194)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[release/7.0-preview2] Update dependencies from dotnet/winforms" (#6190)

Issues.Title: Feature request: Add new "Negate" property in "Trigger" and "Condition" on use Trigger scene.
Issues.Body:
Sometimes we will need to use triggers to make some "not equals to value" scenarios (most common case: value is not null), but for such scenarios it is often necessary to add additional code in the code behind to achieve (such as add a "not" property in entity, or implement IValueConverter, even invert the default value).  
But It seems that just adding a "Negate" property to the `Trigger` and `Condition` can makes everything easier.

Is it possible?? Or why not?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Feature request: Add new "Negate" property in "Trigger" and "Condition" on use Trigger scene." (#6189)

Issues.Body: https://github.com/dotnet/arcade/commit/e44123d2796c8333cf90f90b51dfd9d04d224bea switched GenAPI to run in-proc as an msbuild task. Because of that, the usage is slightly different when additional parameters are passed in to GenAPI.

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[release/7.0-preview1] Update dependencies from dnceng/internal/dotnet-wpf-int" (#6172)

Issues.Title: [Managed DWrite] Migrate Factory to managed
Issues.Body:
Contributes to #5305.

## Description
This is the first part of #5305. I migrated only Factory to managed for now. This should allow to migrate DirectWriteForwarder to C# by migrating everything related to Factory because almost everything related to DWrite starts from Factory.

For now, the bindings to DWrite are generated by dotnet/ClangSharp and modified by hand (I plan to use dotnet/ClangSharp without modifications when I'm able to tune it like I want).

This is only a small chunk of the migration of DirectWriteForwarder to C# but hopefully this will allow to fully migrate it.

## Customer Impact
It might be faster and should allow better support of trimming and the support of NativeAOT once everything is migrated to C#.

## Regression
No.

## Testing
Local build + CI + I tested a few apps to make sure that the text rendering is working.

## Risk
Low. For the most part, it is a copy of the C++ code manually rewritten to C# with as little changes as possible.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "[Managed DWrite] Migrate Factory to managed" (#6171)
